item.title: Now
item.description: Where Am I ? Still in Porto, Portugal. What Am I Currently Doing Trying to do clean-up of all the tech drawers. In addition to doing physical cleaning I am also drilling down on the hobbies that truly matter to me. Could be an interesting follow-up to Why I Stop Doing New Things, Why I Always Want To Do New Things Learning my way around a tambourine, as well as the DAW Bitwig for music production.

item.title: Looking Back On 2023
item.description: If I had to describe 2023 with one word, it would be stabilization. It had a bit of everything for me, ranging from life-threatening encounters to falling in love (and consequently falling out of love). Extreme highs but also extreme lows, which managed to balance each other out near the end of the year and reached an equilibrium. I’m grateful for everything that happened, bad and good alike. Without those experiences, I wouldn’t have grown so much.

item.title: Reminiscing
item.description: Visiting all those places where we dreamed you’d be, Not feeling alone, but there’s an absence in me. I’ve made strides since then, and I hope you have too, Life’s path now clearer, confidence anew. Should fate once again intertwine our two lives, Let’s seize the chance, like old friends who survive. A toast to the memories, the laughter and tears, In each story, we’ll find echoes of our yesteryears.

item.title: Why I Stop Doing Things
item.description: This blog post is a follow-up to What Do I Like, in which I talked about how most of the things I do are short-lived, and that I go through phases of intense focus on one activity followed by dropping it for an indeterminate amount of time. The reason for that? Three words: fear of failure. I’m afraid of failing, afraid of taking risks, afraid of stepping out of my comfort zone, afraid of asking for help, afraid of looking incompetent in the eyes of others.

item.title: Fading
item.description: Under the cherry blossoms my heart rests longing for someone it has never met. Waiting for the winds to sweep it away, Hoping one day it can finally stay. Wilting as each day slowly passes, thoughts of a better life close to none. Constantly comparing itself to the masses, just to find a disappointment to everyone. Full of ambitions and aspirations, aiming for words of validation, but never able to meet expectations.

item.title: Reflection on Mother's Day 2021
item.description: Today, May 2nd, 2021, here in Portugal we celebrate Mother’s Day. It’s a time of joy and happiness where you’re supposed to show appreciation for your mother and everything she has done for you, or is it? I’ll preface the rest of this blog post by saying that I love my mother dearly, even if sometimes I seclude myself in my room for days on end, talk back to her or if I’m a jerk in general to her.

item.title: Stuff I Enjoy: Minecraft
item.description: Welcome to the first installment of Stuff I Enjoy! I was going to postpone this to next week but decided against it. This installment is dedicated to Minecraft, a game that shaped my entire youth. I started playing Minecraft in 2011, around the time that Beta 1.7.3 dropped. It wasn’t until Beta 1.8 that I actually started getting more into it. Why? When I first booted it up, I created a survival world but didn’t know how to break blocks.

item.title: What Do I Like
item.description: Lately, I’ve been trying to get into writing more. My friends Adrian, Alwinfy, and Willie encouraged me to start writing blog posts as it would be a decent way to get started. I thought about it for a while and concluded that they were right. Taking up blogging would be nice. But then, I ran into my first blocker. What would I write? My first instinct was to do some online searching about it, as it was unlikely that I was the only person who didn’t know what to blog.

item.title: About
item.description: Who am I? Greetings! My name is Emanuel Ferraz, better known on the internet as Kamefrede. What do you do? I’m a backend engineer (in job title only, I have no formal engineering degree) at Uphold. Where are you based? In the lovely city of Porto in Portugal. When did you start this blog? 2021, in the middle of the Global Event. Why did you create this blog? Honestly? I saw that my friend williewillus had one, and I thought it’d be cool to have one myself.

item.title: Hello Internet
item.description: After much delaying, I finally caved in and set up a website for real. This is my 3rd attempt at a website, I think. The first attempt went badly since I was trying to minimize the use of Javascript but I still wanted to have fancy animations and navbars and whatnot. For my second attempt I realized that I didn’t need any of that fanciness and was recommended by my friend Williewillus to check out both Jekyll and Hugo.
